content.description: on the sidekick boulder there will be a long diagonal series of rail ledges starting low at the middle of the boulder and trending up and right. "Thumper" sitstarts very low on the lowest usable rail possible, and moves straight up through another ledge to a small nasty crimp. then move up to a little but positive crimp for a dynamic (possible with a static move too) move to the flat top. traverse one move to the right for a good jug.
content.location: on the sidekick boulder there will be a long diagonal series of rail ledges starting low at the middle of the boulder and trending up and right. "Thumper" sitstarts very low on the lowest usable rail possible

content.description:
This is just a harder one move wonder start into a v1 sequence... Not very good, but its there and if you're looking for a 4 to tick off its there to do... Don't plan your trip around it, but if you're in the area why not? 

  Start matched on the thin, tiny crimp rain beneath the ledge on "Side Kickin'". Pick up with diffaculty and toss onto the ledge. Finish as per "Side Kickin'".

On the far left of the Sidekick Boulder. Look for the big jug ledge thing, and then look to the left of that for the juggy portion to sit start upon that is beside the edge of the boulder. 

  Start matched or staggered on the jugs, toss right to the jug ledge and then toss up to the topout sequence.

Sit start in the middle of the boulder at the bottom of the series of long, thin ascending crimp rails. pick up and follow the rails up and right to the top thin rail where you can hit the top lip to top out.
content.location: in the middle of the Sidekick Boulder

content.description: Located in-between the long, right trending, diagonal series of ledge/rails, and the far, short end of the boulder.   look for the low horizontal crimp rail. sit start matched on the rail.   move up into another rail above, and then toss left to a small crimp. move dynamically to the good top out.
content.location: Located in-between the long, right trending, diagonal series of ledge/rails, and the far, short end of the boulder.   look for the low horizontal crimp rail. sit start matched on the rail.

content.description:
Access to Sidekick has been re-opened! Thanks to the hard work and dedication from the Access Fund and the Central Appalachia Climbers Coalition the AVP Boulders have been purchased in order to permanently preserve and protect climber and recreational access for current and future generations. Check out the CACC's website here for continued stewardship initiatives and a link for membership and donations!

 The AVP Boulder and surrounding boulders are some of GHSP's most historical and highly regarded climbing resources. With every grade from v1-v10 these boulders have something for everyone. Only a stone's throw from the parking area, the approach is quick and easy. Landings are great and the forest setting is gorgeous. Come check it out!
